topologicalSort

public LinkedList<T> topologicalSort()
Topologically sort vertices of a directed acyclic graph using one of the two algorithms presented in class. PREREQUISITE: The input graph must be a DAG, i.e., have NO CYCLES. KNOWN BUG: It will get into an infinite loop if the graph has a cycle

Specified by:
topologicalSort in interface GraphPlus<T>
Returns:
the topologically sorted vertices in a linked list Since it is a prerequisite to have no cycles, I did not check for this in my code.

DFS

public LinkedList<T> DFS(T vertex)
Returns a LinkedList contining a DEPTH first search traversal starting at the given index. If the index is not valid, it returns an empty list

Specified by:
DFS in interface GraphPlus<T>
Returns:
a linked list with the vertices in depth-first order

BFS

public LinkedList<T> BFS(T vertex)
Returns a LinkedList contining a BREADTH first search traversal starting at the given index. If the index is not valid, it returns an empty list

Specified by:
